page.title: 14Tresillian Barton Farm
page.content: Farming has been carried on here for a very long time.The name means 'the home farm in the sun' and was spelled Tresulian in 1335. It has been the home farm of the Trisillian Estate since medieval times Sir Robert Tresillian b.1340 was made Lord Chief Justice by Richard 2nd to suppress the Peasants Revolt.He condemned 1500 people to death by hanging, but in 1386 he was beheaded at Tyburn and hanged up-side down in chains. Today the farm is owned by Mr Rex Davey and Sons.It is located 240 feet above sea level and four miles from Newquay.Farming is highly mechanised, being mainly devoted to the production of milk,beef and lamb based on home grown cereals and intensive use of grassland.Three-quarters of farm revenue comes from livestock.
